page.title: 05PLANE CRASH
page.content: On Christmas Eve 1944 an American built Wildcat, J.V. 482 crashed returning to base from Sydenham Airport,Belfast. It crashed into Portmore Lough, in the S.W. corner of this block. The pilot was rescued by two local farmers. Forty years on in April 1984, the aircraft was raised from the lough by the Ulster Aviation Society. The plane was well preserved, the engine in near perfect condition: the tyres still held the 40 year-old air, and 15 gallons of 100 octane aviation fuel was found to be in perfect condition. The plane was moved to suitable premises in Belfast and will be the centre of a new aviation museum. A fitting climax to the saga saw the emotional meeting of the pilot, Peter Lock with William and Seamus Kane his rescuers on a fateful day.
